author: Morgan Jeffery
title: Doctor Who's YA spinoff Class is not just for teens, insists Patrick Ness - Doctor Who Cult -
text: © BBC Doctor Who is getting a new YA spinoff - but writer Patrick Ness has dismissed the idea that Class is only for teens.Ness, an acclaimed YA author, posted a series of tweets last night insisting the show won't be "light" and is intended for all ages.He talked up the "ambition" and "breadth" of YA fiction, which he argued is consumed by a wide variety of readers - not just teenagers.I mean, good heavens, have you seen the ambition & breadth YA has these days? It's a verdant field. #verdant— Patrick Ness (@Patrick_Ness) October 2, 2015That's that cleared up then, but since Class is set in Coal Hill School - where current Doctor Who companion Clara Oswald works as a teacher - could Jenna Coleman be leaving the parent series to star in the spinoff?Not according to Ness, who also clarified broadcast plans for the series - suggesting that the new series will debut on BBC Three online and get a repeat airing on BBC One.Btw, plan is, "Class" airs on BBC3 online, then on BBC1, at which point the new episode of "Class" hits BBC3. It's cool.— Patrick Ness (@Patrick_Ness) October 2, 2015Class - an eight-part series - will start filming in early 2016 and air later in the year.Doctor Who's head writer Steven Moffat and executive producer Brian Minchin will work with Ness on the project.Doctor Who in crisis?
